column1: # F00: highway-expansion - Add 2 lanes to major highways and interchanges ($800M)
# F01: congestion-pricing - Charge $5-15 to drive downtown during peak hours
# F02: protected-bike-lanes - Network of physically separated bike lanes on major streets (removes 1 car lane)
# F03: transit-frequency-boost - Double bus/rail frequency by adding vehicles and drivers ($200M/year operating cost)
# F04: parking-restrictions - Remove 40% of downtown street parking
column2: convert to bus lanes and bike lanes

column1: # F05: suburban-park-and-ride - Build 5 large parking lots at suburban transit stations (5000 spaces

column2: walkable development near transit (apartments above shops)

column1: # F07: free-transit - Eliminate all transit fares
# F08: traffic-enforcement - Automated speed and red light cameras with $200+ fines
# F09: electric-bus-conversion - Replace entire diesel bus fleet with electric buses ($400M capital)
# F10: employer-transit-subsidies - Require large employers to subsidize employee transit passes (tax incentive)
# F11: bike-share-expansion - 5000-bike dockless bike share system across city ($10M + $3M/year)
# F12: road-diet-conversions - Convert 4-lane roads to 3-lane (2+center turn) with bike lanes on 20 major streets
# F13: transit-priority-signals - Traffic signals give green lights to approaching buses/trains
# F14: parking-price-increase - Triple downtown parking meter rates ($2/hr to $6/hr)
